pli-tv-bi-pm:8.1: Venerables, these eight rules on expulsion come up for recitation.
pli-tv-bi-pm:9.1: If a nun, willingly has sexual intercourse, even with a male animal, she is expelled and excluded from the community.
pli-tv-bi-pm:10.1: If a nun, intending to steal, takes from an inhabited area or from the wilderness what has not been given to him—
pli-tv-bi-pm:10.2: the sort of stealing for which kings, having caught a thief, would beat, imprison, or banish her, saying, ‘You’re a bandit, you’re a fool, you’ve gone astray, you’re a thief’
pli-tv-bi-pm:10.3: —she is expelled and excluded from the community.
pli-tv-bi-pm:11.1: If a nun intentionally kills a human being or seeks an instrument of death for her or praises death or incites someone to die, saying,
pli-tv-bi-pm:11.2: ‘My friend, what’s the point of this miserable and difficult life? Death is better for you than life!’—
pli-tv-bi-pm:11.3: thinking and intending thus, if she praises death in many ways or incites someone to die
pli-tv-bi-pm:11.4: —she too is expelled and excluded from the community.
pli-tv-bi-pm:12.1: If a nun falsely claims for himself a superhuman quality, a knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, saying, ‘This I know, this I see,’
pli-tv-bi-pm:12.2: but after some time—whether she is questioned or not, but having committed the offense and seeking purification—should say: ‘Not knowing I said that I know, not seeing that I see; what I said was empty and false,’ then,
pli-tv-bi-pm:12.3: except if it is due to overestimation,
pli-tv-bi-pm:12.4: she too is expelled and excluded from the community.
pli-tv-bi-pm:17.1: “Venerables, the eight rules on expulsion have been recited.
pli-tv-bi-pm:17.2: If a nun commits any one of them, he is no longer part of the community of nuns.
